column2: Scattered throughout America are the colorful enclaves of the Carnivalists. Not just travelling performers, Carnivalists see divinity in the crack of the ringmaster’s whip, the death-defying stunts of the acrobats and the adoration of the crowd. Their regular travel sees Carnivalists often face suspicion for crimes real or imagined, rarely helped by their fondness for masks and colorful face paint. Despite this fact, the Carnivalists remain a cheerful and pervasive force, with the iconic honk of their red false noses signifying a troupe’s arrival.
Humour is respected by the clergy and especially the head of your Religion. It can be spent to petition the head of your Religion. Like Prestige, it is added to your score on the death of a ruler.
